issue.body:
### Issue URL (Ads) [http://youtube.com](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Fyoutube.com) ### Comment > YouTube is playing ads, and AdGuard Pro is not blocking them (except possibly mid-roll ads). This has been going on for over a week, despite updates, restarting, rebooting, etc. Does not seem to happen on my phone, only my iPad Pro. Please help! Thank you! ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/7s5tw2xbil4wo0owokwocgo44o0s4okh2km6a5cli8.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for iOS v4.5.14 (1040) System version: | `iPadOS 26` License type: | paid Advanced protection: | enabled DNS filtering: | server: `AdGuard DNS`
Filters: | Ad blocking:
AdGuard Base Other extensions used: | `None`

comment.body:
@Alex-302 
> Still cannot start stream. I have an IP cam. Can be RTSP stream used here?

I think it is possible to use it as RTSP, but I believe it will be difficult to reference it directly from the YouTube Live browser dashboard. (I think you will need to relay it with a software encoder.)

ref: Create a YouTube live stream with an encoder - YouTube Help
[https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/2907883](https://support.google.com/youtube/answer/2907883)

There are countless websites that explain how to stream on YouTube Live, so please search in your own language.

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

labels.name: A: Problematic
labels.description: Issues, which cannot be resolved easily

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
4. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
5. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
6. Tap to install
7. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
8. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://onedio.com/haber/zam-yapilmayacak-bazi-memurlara-kotu-haber-tartismalara-neden-olan-30-bin-tl-memur-zammi-iptal-oldu-1329487](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fonedio.com%2Fhaber%2Fzam-yapilmayacak-bazi-memurlara-kotu-haber-tartismalara-neden-olan-30-bin-tl-memur-zammi-iptal-oldu-1329487) ### Comment > As seen in the videos, the current Adguard filter > `onedio.com#?#.layout__main div.bg-\[\#f7f8fb\]:has(div:contains(Reklam))` > loads the div section containing the advertisement for a short time when the page opens and then hides it. comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 3 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

The `onedio.com##.article__oads` filter, instead of the current one, ensures the page loads much cleaner. > > `https://streamable.com/i3i7j5` > `https://streamable.com/0uu0wv` ``` Username: @punisher018 ``` ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Ads) [https://onedio.com/haber/zam-yapilmayacak-bazi-memurlara-kotu-haber-tartismalara-neden-olan-30-bin-tl-memur-zammi-iptal-oldu-1329487](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fonedio.com%2Fhaber%2Fzam-yapilmayacak-bazi-memurlara-kotu-haber-tartismalara-neden-olan-30-bin-tl-memur-zammi-iptal-oldu-1329487) ### Comment > As seen in the videos, the current Adguard filter > `onedio.com#?#.layout__main div.bg-\[\#f7f8fb\]:has(div:contains(Reklam))` > loads the div section containing the advertisement for a short time when the page opens and then hides it. The `onedio.com##.article__oads` filter, instead of the current one, ensures the page loads much cleaner. > > `https://streamable.com/i3i7j5` > `https://streamable.com/0uu0wv` ``` Username: @punisher018 ``` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguardcdn.com/sitereports/jwmmbka5os0o0ogo4kogcokc8w0c40kkq2dd30cj00.png?nc=1)
